description: RIA-1939 Send appeal (allowed) decision notification to Home Office and Legal Representative - Admin Officer

notifications.subject: Immigration and Asylum appeal: decision and reasons
body: The Tribunal has made a decision about this appeal
The grounds for this decision are explained in the Decision and Reasons document.
Visit the online service and use the reference given in this email to find the case. You can then view and download the Decision and Reasons document from the Documents tab.
If you think there's a legal error in the Tribunal's decision, you can ask for permission to appeal to the Upper Tribunal (Immigration and Asylum Chamber).

notifications.subject: Immigration and Asylum appeal: decision and reasons
body: The Tribunal has made a decision about this appeal

The grounds for this decision are explained in the Decision and Reasons document. If the appeal has been allowed on some grounds and dismissed on others, overall this means the appeal is allowed and, unless the Home Office appeals, the decision should be implemented.
Visit the online service and use the reference given in this email to find the case. You can then view and download the Decision and Reasons document from the Documents tab.

If the Home Office thinks there's a legal error in the Tribunal's decision, they can ask for permission to appeal to the Upper Tribunal (Immigration and Asylum Chamber). You'll be notified if the Home Office asks for permission to appeal.
